EJ's EVERQUEST CHARACTERS

note: i am aware that this site is crap and boring...
i just dont care at this point. When I do, i will revamp it.
I thought I would take some time, again, (finally, whatever) to make a site dedicated to my Characters in Everquest.
I have devoted quite a bit of time to this game, as can be seen by the creation dates and play times listed for some of them.
Although I have never, and I mean that, NEVER, even come close to the max level at any point since i started playing,
I have enjoyed every minute, except some of the more ugly corpse runs, of course.
Anyway, on to the reason for the site: my characters.

Picture/Character Name:
Brief Bio:
Birthday/Skills:
My very first character
Garskold
My first character was Garskold, a human wizard from Freeport. Unfortunately for him, he was to be short-lived. The Bertox server, where I started him, was soon to split into Terris-Thule. Although my friends in the game made it a point to tell me they were leaving in the split, I never made it. When I rejoined them on the T-T server, poor Garskold was abandoned at level 13.

Skill Info:
  • At this time, i have no skill info on this char.
  • As i never log onto Bertox, i can't say when i will get it.

ACCOUNT 1 - No, I don't have any other hobbies...
Grimguard
Dirtnappin
Grimguard was my next character and my first on Terris-Thule. Playing a warrior definitely is an experience. Your party lives or dies, levels or leaves, based on your ability to pull and damage your enemy.
I have always associated a little part of me with the very simple way Grimguard approaches the world. "If I keep hitting it, one of two things will happen. It will either die, or it will get annoyed and kill me. Bring it on!"
While not officially retired, Grimguard is on a hiatus. He was guild leader of the Collective of Dark Honour, and the tragedy of its near-dissolution was too much for his warrior's mind to take. He pops in occasionally to give a shout, but for the most part, he is a rare level 54 spawn these days.

Skill Info:
  • Brewing -
  • Alcohol Tolerance -
  • Blacksmith -

Leandriana
Deviatedseptum
While Leandrian wasn't the next character created, she is my current main. This earns her a rank higher than my alts. She is currently level 59.
Created on a whim one day and then played only randomly for almost a year, when Grimguard decided he needed a break, Leandriana stepped up to fill his place. In the time since then, she has become a power unto herself.
Playing a mage is a different experience, as you are essentially support for your pet, if you work things right. It takes a patient person to wait a few seconds for the pet to get aggro before making a move and nuking the mob. I think I finally may have learned the patience necessary.
Being able to summon her own supplies and some gear, Leandriana is alot more self-reliant than a warrior could ever be. Adding a pet only sweetens the deal. Solo, or grouping with a cleric, is so much easier.

Skill Info:

  • Tailoring -
